{{also|贯盈}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=贯盈}}

===Etymology===
[[貫]] (a [[string]] of [[coins]]) + [[盈]] ([[full]])
: In ancient times, coins had holes in their centers so that the could be threaded onto strings. When a string of preset length ([[貫]]) became full ([[盈]]), this term was used to describe it. Later, the term came to refer to an abundance of evil deeds.

# {{lb|zh|literary}} an [[abundance]] of ([[evil]] [[deed]]s etc.)
